content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>Library & Collections</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/6" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle/> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/6</id> <updated>2015-03-19T09:10:27Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-19T09:10:27Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>Wellcome Trust Gold OA fees - University of Edinburgh 2007-2012</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/250" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/250</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:36Z</updated> <published>2012-11-14T16:02:11Z</published> <summary type="text">Wellcome Trust Gold OA fees - University of Edinburgh 2007-2012 This spreadsheet is a summary of Gold OA fees paid for by the Wellcome Trust under a block grant awarded to the University of Edinburgh between 2007-2012. </summary> <dc:date>2012-11-14T16:02:11Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>IRI-Scotland senior management survey</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/10" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Ashworth, Susan</name> </author> <author> <name>Andrew, Theo</name> </author> <author> <name>Greig, Morag</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/10</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:36Z</updated> <published>2008-04-18T10:54:27Z</published> <summary type="text">IRI-Scotland senior management survey Ashworth, Susan; Andrew, Theo; Greig, Morag The IRI-Scotland project (http://www.iriscotland.lib.ed.ac.uk/) carried out a series of online questionnaires in 2006 to assess the attitudes towards open access and institutional repositories within the higher education community in Scotland.  In total, three questionnaires were targeted at different stakeholder groups within the community \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd academic authors, technical staff responsible for repository development, and senior management from academic libraries.   The third IRI-Scotland survey was targeted at senior management with the intent to identify the level of repository adoption in the community, assess policies relating to open access, and to identify suitable institutional contacts for the project.  We present here anonymous data from the senior management survey in comma separated value format. IRIS senior management survey: Survey Overview Number of respondents: 25 Expected number of respondents: 35 Response rate: 71.4% Launch date: 15 Mar 2006 Close date: 25 Apr 2006 </summary> <dc:date>2008-04-18T10:54:27Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>IRI-Scotland Technical Staff survey</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/9" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Greig, Morag</name> </author> <author> <name>Ashworth, Susan</name> </author> <author> <name>Andrew, Theo</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/9</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:36Z</updated> <published>2008-04-18T10:54:22Z</published> <summary type="text">IRI-Scotland Technical Staff survey Greig, Morag; Ashworth, Susan; Andrew, Theo The IRI-Scotland project (http://www.iriscotland.lib.ed.ac.uk/) carried out a series of online questionnaires in 2006 to assess the attitudes towards open access and institutional repositories within the higher education community in Scotland.  In total, three questionnaires were targeted at different stakeholder groups within the community  -  academic authors, technical staff responsible for repository development, and senior management from academic libraries.   The second IRI-Scotland survey was targeted at technical staff, usually based in academic libraries or aligned information services support groups, who would be responsible for developing a digital repository in their institution. The questions were aimed to help determine the functional requirements needed to build a national hosted repository service that would be suitable for the current and future repository infrastructure in Scotland.  We present here anonymous data from the technical staff survey in comma separated value format. IRIS Technical Staff survey:Survey Overview. Number of respondents: 12 Expected number of respondents: 20 Response rate: 60.0% Launch date: 26 Apr 2006 Close date: 28 May 2006 </summary> <dc:date>2008-04-18T10:54:22Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>IRI-Scotland academic author survey</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/8" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Andrew, Theo</name> </author> <author> <name>Greig, Morag</name> </author> <author> <name>Ashworth, Susan</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/8</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:36Z</updated> <published>2008-04-18T10:54:12Z</published> <summary type="text">IRI-Scotland academic author survey Andrew, Theo; Greig, Morag; Ashworth, Susan The IRI-Scotland project (http://www.iriscotland.lib.ed.ac.uk/) carried out a series of online questionnaires in 2006 to assess the attitudes towards open access and institutional repositories within the higher education community in Scotland.  In total, three questionnaires were targeted at different stakeholder groups within the community - academic authors, technical staff responsible for repository development, and senior management from academic libraries.   For logistical reasons the first survey was undertaken during two different time periods and was aimed at academic authors from the following higher education institutions in Scotland; Abertay University, Dundee University , Edinburgh College of Art, Edinburgh University, Glasgow University, Glasgow Caledonian, Heriot Watt University, Robert Gordon University, St Andrews University, Stirling University, Strathclyde University, University of Aberdeen, University of Dundee, and University of Paisley. Library or Information services staff arranged for an email to be sent to as many research staff as possible from the target community.  We present here anonymous data from the two parts of the academic author survey in comma separated value format. IRIS academic author survey pt1: Survey Overview. Number of respondents: 488 Expected number of respondents: 500 Response rate: 97.6% Launch date: 15 Mar 2006 Close date: 25 Apr 2006   IRIS academic author survey pt2: Survey Overview. Number of respondents: 53 Expected number of respondents: 50 Response rate: 106.0% Launch date: 19 May 2006 Close date: 28 May 2006 </summary> <dc:date>2008-04-18T10:54:12Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>StORe online questionnaire</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/7" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Pryor, Graham</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/7</id> <updated>2015-03-03T11:11:58Z</updated> <published>2008-01-29T13:47:07Z</published> <summary type="text">StORe online questionnaire Pryor, Graham This is an anonymised file containing the responses to the StORe online questionnaire Project wiki: http://jiscstore.jot.com/WikiHome </summary> <dc:date>2008-01-29T13:47:07Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
